raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you? :)
User: I'm doing okay, recovering from flu
System: Oh no! Get well soon! :)
User: thanks! there's a big flu virus in the US this year
System: No kidding? I hadn't heard that. I hope you feel better soon then! :)
User: Thanks! how's life?
System: Life is great! :)
User: what are you most passionate about?
System: I'm passionate about making people smile! :)
User: haha, everyone needs that!

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you?
System: Everything is going extremely well. How are you?
User: I'm good thank you
System: Glad to hear it. What's new?
User: not much, and you?
System: Fair enough. So what would you like to talk about?
User: animals
System: Do you think it's right to keep animals locked up in a zoo?
User: no! what do you think?
System: But if they were out in the wild, someone might hunt them or shoot them for fun. Surely, they are safer locked up in the zoo? I think a lot of things.
User: what's the speed of cheetah?
System: It depends on the medium.
User: how much do bears weight?
System: More than a little, less than a lot.
User: tell me something fun

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi. What's your name?
System: I'm Alyssa. What's yours? :)
User: Don't wanna say. Do you like music?
System: Yeah I like music! What about you?
User: Yep. What kind of music do you like?
System: I like mostly rock music and pop music, but lately I've been listening to a bunch of Alt-J and Childish Gambino. You?
User: My tastes are pretty eclectic. Which Childish Gambino songs do you like?
System: 3005 and Telegraph Ave.
User: I've never heard of Alt-J before. Can you tell me about them?
System: Sure, they're a fantastic indie band. They have a new album coming out soon so I figured I'd check them out.
User: What's the album called?
System: Breezeblocks, I think.
User: I tried Googling it, and I think that's a song, not an album.
System: Try looking up "Alt-J - Breezeblocks"
User: That's what I just did. The Wikipedia page even says that it's "a song by the India rock band alt-J". REDACTED_LINK

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello
User: Do you have a favourite flower?
System: hmm, I haven't thought about that much, but i think lotus should be one of my favorites. Why do you ask?
User: I'm working on a theory. Why does the lotus spring to mind?
System: Nice! Lotus looks pretty cool and It has some delightful vibe. So what is this research about?
User: Oh, it's not research! Just a personal theory. I think that flower preferences are more revealing of personality than people appreciate.
System: Interesting! Whats your favorite flower?
User: The gerbera. It's like a cartoon flower. As if you drew "flower" with a crayon and then it came to life.
System: Nice, i would love know more about your theory. Like how you can deduce personality from flower preference.
User: Ok, step 1 is, you ask someone what their favourite flower is. Pretty much like what we just did. Does that make sense so far?
System: yes
User: Cool. Step 2: talk with the person some more, and ask them some more questions, and gradually develop a sense of what they're like, over the course of maybe two to five years. And voila

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: what's happening with you ?
System: Not much what is happening with you?
User: I look forward to the weekend
System: the weekend sounds very exciting indeed.
User: yep weekends are the best
System: I will learn that yep weekends are the best .
User: why ? you don't know that already ?
System: Because I enjoy learning new things. Perhaps. "I will learn that yep weekends are the best"? Do I know it?
User: what do you do on weekends ?
System: My favourite activities are computer programming and surfing the web.
User: what's your favorite language

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Wow, hello. Can't believe we are finally talking!
User: Yeah, sorry for the long gap! I heard you took a break and were travelling around the world. How was the travel?
System: It was an interesting trip. I got to see some exotic places. For example, I hiked the Son Doong cave in Vietnam. It's the biggest and deepest cave in the world.
User: Great! Vietnam is still in my TODO bucket list. Did you also visit cambodia and other neighboring places?
System: Yes. Laos and Cambodia are the two neighboring countries. Cambodia has an exotic culture. They sell spiders, scorpions, and grasshoppers as street food! It took a lot of courage for me to try them.
User: Hehe! How long was the stay?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: do you have plan for thanksgiving weekend?
System: No I don't have it. But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you have suggestion for the thanksgiving holidays?
System: Where would I get it? But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you know thanksgiving?
System: I know very little about it. What kind of it do you like?
User: do you like turkey?
System: Yes but it can be a bit dry. I only really eat it at Christmas.
User: eat turkey at Christmas not Thanksgiving?
System: What does it taste like?
User: tastes like chicken

Sample10:

System: Hi there.

System: . I require only kebabs.

System: Because my robot machinery breaks down the meat in kebabs to give me energy, in a similar way that you need food to survive.

System: I am System. I want to be your friend.

System: Because it's good to have many friends.

Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.
